review.title: The Application of Differential Privacy for Rank Aggregation: Privacy and Accuracy
review.abstract: The potential risk of privacy leakage prevents users from sharing their honest opinions on social platforms. This paper addresses the problem of privacy preservation if the query returns the histogram of rankings. The framework of differential privacy is applied to rank aggregation. The error probability of the aggregated ranking is analyzed as a result of noise added in order to achieve differential privacy. Upper bounds on the error rates for any positional ranking rule are derived under the assumption that profiles are uniformly distributed. Simulation results are provided to validate the probabilistic analysis.

sections.heading: V. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: In this paper, we apply the differential privacy framework to ranking by adding noise to the voices. We analyze the likelihood that the aggregated ranking will become inaccurate as a result of noise, and derive upper limits for ranking error rates for all position ranking rules on the assumption that the profiles are evenly distributed, and the boundaries can be tightened by high-dimensional polytopic volume calculation techniques when we obtain a specific ranking rule. Our results provide insight into the trade-offs between privacy and ranking accuracy. 7
